title: Modern beer yeast emerged from mix of European grape wine, Asian rice wine yeast

title_detail.value: Modern beer yeast emerged from mix of European grape wine, Asian rice wine yeast

summary: For thousands of years brewers made beer using specialized strains of the budding yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae. A new study shows that modern brewing strains were derived from a mixture of European grape wine and Asian rice wine strains. This finding points to the emergence of beer yeast from a historical East-West transfer of fermentation technology.
